poem:
**By-election, Denton**

Car horns—  
a thin music in wet streets.  
Farage counting years  
like coins in his pocket,  
data and doors,  
shoulder to wheel.

Across the way  
a plumber—Hannah Spencer—  
with a wrench's calm,  
tightens what leaks.

Votes fall  
like grit in gutters,  
and the morning  
keeps moving.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Greens pick former mayoral hopeful Hannah Spencer as Gorton byelection candidate – UK politics live 11.58am GMT Reform UK leader Nigel Farage said he is confident that Matthew Goodwin, the party’s candidate in the Gorton and Denton byelection, is the right person for the job as he spoke to supporters in the Greater Manchester constituency. It all depended on getting Reform’s message out there and “finding the people that agree with us”, according to Farage. “We’ve got an excellent, strong candidate who I’ve known for... 15 years? Fifteen years? Something like that,” he said during a campaign trail in Denton earlier today. “And I know Matt is going absolutely to put his shoulder to the wheel and work very, very hard. “The key to this is finding the people out there that agree with us. Getting that down on our data, and then turning them out on the day. “If we do that, we’ve got every chance of winning.” That message has reached some people, judging by the car horns that blared in support during his walkabout in Denton. Some van drivers shouted words of encouragement, telling Farage to “keep it up lad”. 11.27am GMT Green party announces former mayoral candidate to run in Gorton and Denton byelection The Green party has unveiled Hannah Spencer, a Trafford councillor and plumber, as its candidate to stand in the Gorton and Denton byeelection. Her nomination was officially announced on Friday in Longsight, with the decision having been made by local party members". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Greens pick former mayoral hopeful Hannah Spencer as Gorton byelection candidate – UK politics live 11.58am GMT Reform UK leader Nigel Farage said he is confident that Matthew Goodwin, the party’s candidate in the Gorton and Denton byelection, is the right person for the job as he spoke to supporters in the Greater Manchester constituency. It all depended on getting Reform’s message out there and “finding the people that agree with us”, according to Farage. “We’ve got an excellent, strong candidate who I’ve known for... 15 years? Fifteen years? Something like that,” he said during a campaign trail in Denton earlier today. “And I know Matt is going absolutely to put his shoulder to the wheel and work very, very hard. “The key to this is finding the people out there that agree with us. Getting that down on our data, and then turning them out on the day. “If we do that, we’ve got every chance of winning.” That message has reached some people, judging by the car horns that blared in support during his walkabout in Denton. Some van drivers shouted words of encouragement, telling Farage to “keep it up lad”. 11.27am GMT Green party announces former mayoral candidate to run in Gorton and Denton byelection The Green party has unveiled Hannah Spencer, a Trafford councillor and plumber, as its candidate to stand in the Gorton and Denton byeelection. Her nomination was officially announced on Friday in Longsight, with the decision having been made by local party members
